Can you squash you commits so I can merge?
@bolkedebruin, I did squash of this and #2269
@OpringaoDoTurno  Does this repro on reload? It appears to work fine internally
@artwr do we still want this? If not, I will abandon.

@saguziel Yes, it reproduces. 
In fact, it is something that happens always (no amount of page reloads or server restarts has solved it) to some few DAGs (not all of them) but always to the same ones.

Found it!

It seems it can be solved with a simple sort:
Old behaviour relied on `task.get_task_instances` and new one on `dag.get_task_instances` and seems to be differences between the two: one is (one is sorted by `execution_date`, the other isn't)

It can be solved adding a sort (`tis.sort(key=lambda x: x.execution_date)`) after `dag.get_task_instances` (around line 1422 in views.py your commit) 

I'll start preparing a pull request :)
@OpringaoDoTurno, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @bolkedebruin, @mistercrunch and @patrickleotardif to be potential reviewers.

Something is going wrong here. I see a lot of unrelated commits in the changes.

This is definitely something that should be included in the Spark-submit operator. Maybe we can also include the `_name` field to the template_fields.

Regarding the different commits that are on your branch. I would suggest creating a clean branch from master, and then cherrypick you changes `git cherry-pick cb7929116764ef3464622220222e40d343b20a08` on top.
LGTM
LGTM

LGTM

Opting to allow the param to be inserted in the middle of the param list. This is technically backwards incompatible because it changes the param ordering if someone is calling the method with full param list. It's uglier to append at the end, and I suspect most if not all are going to be using kwargs when making this call.

Job already done, see #2289. / Was #2282 which I closed for commit reordering issue.
This PR contains #2282 plus additional Jira  1184
@vfoucault I'm fine with either PR being merged. I only saw the closing of the previous PR so decided to make my own since I needed the functionallity

Good. Either way i ve not added the template field for sql operator.

Regards.

Is there anyone to focus this ?

Hello,

you have a error 500 with landscape cause it's not working anymore (for now ?)

did you checked the user_defined_macros, with value to {'mynumber': 2} as DAG parameter, instead of param ? 
from the doc : 

 :param hiveconf_jinja_translate: when True, hiveconf-type templating
        ${var} gets translated into jinja-type templating {{ var }}. Note that
        you may want to use this along with the
        ``DAG(user_defined_macros=myargs)`` parameter. View the DAG
        object documentation for more details.

don't know much about the hive operator, but is there any test that you can add to hive_operator or/and operator helper ?

regards.
Can you please cleanup your commit message (see guidelines) and see if you need to split the patch across two commits that address the jira's separately?
@NielsZeilemaker can you please rebase and fix conflicts? Sorry.
Can you rebase & retrigger the build so we can verify if it is ok?
please squash your commits, make sure you follow the commit guidelines for the commit message and then we are good to go.
@bolkedebruin done

Is there any way to re trigger the travis build without a new push ?
the error is 
```log
11) FAIL: test_scheduler_run_duration (tests.SchedulerJobTest) (11s vs 5s)
```
and build is ok on my branch : 
https://travis-ci.org/vfoucault/incubator-airflow ->bid 8 for same commit number (e60aab8)

thx.
You could try to do a force push of the same commit, this might trigger a new build.
No effect.  I'll go with a empty commit then
I think it is not a problem, the committers are aware of the fact that the tests are sometimes a bit flakey.

I think we're good now, let me know.

kr.
@avigil-twist, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @mistercrunch, @normster and @t1m0thy to be potential reviewers.
Hi, testing this template field is quite an easy thing and improve global code quality. Check #2289 for template testing.
no problem, I'll take a look and add a test
added a unit test `test_templated_trigger_dagrun`. Travis build seems to be failing for reasons unrelated to this PR

@Fokko tests are not flaky any more. So no we don't accept non passing tests anymore. Exception could be due to changes to underlying dependencies (i.e. a version has changed).

LGTM
-- LGTM
@r39132 ping, is this abandoned?

@fordguo can you please follow the commit guidelines? Ie add the JIRA to your commit message subject, squash your commits etc?

then we can merge.
@bolkedebruin rebased and build looks to be running now. Let me know if you need anything else.
The CI failure is due to AIRFLOW-1179 and not related to this PR.
@criccomini @NielsZeilemaker the travis' builds on master are current failing with errors in BigQuery/Pandas can you guys have look?

please *squash* your commits.

I'm not sure if this is still current or will be updated. But I think the approach can be much simpler and still allowing the full reset to happen (instead of batch) by additional filtering on the queued_tis. 

Furthermore, the task instance should be locked in the db (with_for_update) when updating the state. We see issues testing with multiple schedulers due to no locking.
We should bring this back to life @jlowin !
@vfoucault, thanks for your PR! By analyzing the history of the files in this pull request, we identified @Fokko, @cameres and @hgrif to be potential reviewers.
@bolkedebruin changed. I've pushed the new commit and updated the PR title
I think this is now in line with the guidelines -- anything I missed?
Any updates? We are also in need of this option in our setup.

While investigating this it seems that updating the gunicorn version could solve this issue.

Gunicorn [`19.5.0`](https://github.com/benoitc/gunicorn/releases/tag/19.5.0) introduced an alternative to `--forwarded-allow-ips` config, where you can define an environment variable `FORWARDED_ALLOW_IPS` to override the default `"127.0.0.1"` value. http://docs.gunicorn.org/en/stable/settings.html#forwarded-allow-ips.

Even further in [`19.7.0`](https://github.com/benoitc/gunicorn/releases/tag/19.7.0) there is `GUNICORN_CMD_ARGS` that could be used to pass arguments to the running gunicorn.

This is something that could be investigated as an alternative option as there is a [PR to support the gunicorn versions `> 19.4.0`](https://github.com/apache/incubator-airflow/pull/2237)
